greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle a(n,k) of partitions of n objects of 2 colors, k of which are black and each part with at least one black object.
comment: Number of ways to factor p^(n-k)*q^k where p and q are distinct primes and each factor is a multiple of q.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, j, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, `if`(k=0, 1, 0),
b(n, i, j-1, k)+`if`(i>n or j>k, 0, b(n-i, i, j, k-j)))))
seq(seq(a(n,k), k=1..n), n=1..15);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 14 2015
mathematica: b[n_, i_, j_, k_] := b[n, i, j, k] = If[n == 0, If[k == 0, 1, 0], If[i < 1 || k < 1, 0, If[j < 1, b[n, i - 1, i - 1, k], b[n, i, j - 1, k] + If[i > n || j > k, 0, b[n - i, i, j, k - j]]]]]; a[n_, k_] :=  b[n, n, k, k]; Table[a[n, k], {n, 1, 15}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 10 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_ and _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 08 2004
